intro: Psychotria fulva var. madraspatana, commonly known as the Madras Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and have a distinctive dark green color with a slight pubescence. The flowers are small, white or pale pink, and are clustered in inflorescences, often producing a faintly aromatic scent.
